intro: Doemia schmittiana, commonly known as the Schmitt's doemia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
